titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Forlani et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Opinion and Order: Defendant Dimora's motion for consolidation with case 1:10CR387 (Doc. No. 32) is denied. Because the Court will not consolidate these two matters, Dimora's motion to continue the trial date in Dimora I (1:10CR387-- Doc. No. 539) is also denied. Judge Sara Lioi on 12/16/2011. (P,J)Opinion and Order: Defendant Dimora's motion for consolidation with case 1:10CR387 (Doc. No. 32) is denied. Because the Court will not consolidate these two matters, Dimora's motion to continue the trial date in Dimora I (1:10CR387-- Doc. No. 539) is also denied. Judge Sara Lioi on 12/16/2011. (P,J)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Forlani et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Opinion and Order: Denying Defendant Michael Forlani's 46 SEALED Motion to have present case reassigned to a district judge by random draw. This case was properly transferred to the undersigned as a related case under the Court's local criminal rules. Judge Sara Lioi on 2/3/2012. (P,G)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Forlani et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Order: For the reasons set forth by the government, the Court finds that the dismissal of the present indictment as against defendant Dimora would not be clearly contrary to manifest public interest. The government's motion to dismiss is granted, and all charges against defendant Dimora are hereby dismissed. This case shall proceed against defendant Michael Forlani as to all counts. (Related Doc # 56). Judge Sara Lioi on 5/25/2012. (P,J)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:11-cr-00491; United States of America v. Forlani et al;

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Forlani et al

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Forlani et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Opinion and Order as to Michael Forlani: The Court hereby denies defendant's motion to transfer this case to Cleveland. (Doc. No. 79). Defendant is, however, granted leave to file a motion for a continuance of the trial date within seven (7) days of the filing of this order, should he and his counsel believe that such a motion is warranted. Judge Sara Lioi on 8/14/2012. (P,J)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 1:11-cr-00491; United States of America v. Forlani et al;

Judge Sara Lioi on 8/14/2012. (P,J)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Forlani et al
titleInfo.subTitle: Opinion and Order granting in part and denying in part defendant Michael Forlani's motion for immediate pre-sentence discovery. (Doc. No. 117). The government shall provide to the defendant and the Court more specific and meaningful details relating to its loss calculations by November 26, 2012. Specifically, the government shall identify the specific basis for each monetary amount set forth in its Sentencing Memorandum. In essence, the Court is requiring the government to "show its work" with respect to its loss computations. Additionally, while the Court will not require the government to provide witness statements at this time, or other Jencks material, it encourages the government to provide such evidence as soon as possible to avoid unnecessary delays at sentencing. Judge Sara Lioi on 11/19/2012. (P,J)
